goals.question: What is the distribution of departure delays?
goals.rationale: This tells us how many flights are delayed and by how much time. It can help identify patterns and potential causes of delays.

goals.question: What is the relationship between departure delays and arrival delays?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of departure delays vs arrival delays
goals.rationale: This can help identify if there is a correlation between the two variables. It can also help identify if there are any outliers or patterns in the data.

goals.question: What is the distribution of flight distances?
goals.rationale: This tells us how many flights are short-haul vs long-haul. It can help identify potential differences in flight operations and scheduling.

goals.question: What is the distribution of flight cancellations?
goals.visualization: Bar chart of flight cancellations by airline
goals.rationale: This can help identify which airlines have the highest number of cancellations. It can also help identify potential reasons for cancellations such as weather or mechanical issues.

goals.question: What is the distribution of flight delays by airline?
goals.visualization: Box plot of flight delays by airline
goals.rationale: This can help identify which airlines have the highest average delays. It can also help identify potential differences in flight operations and scheduling between airlines.

code:
import pandas as pd
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    sns.histplot(data=data, x='departure_delay')
    plt.title('What is the distribution of departure delays?', wrap=True)
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import pandas as pd
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    sns.scatterplot(x='departure_delay', y='arrival_delay', data=data)
    plt.title('What is the relationship between departure delays and arrival delays?', wrap=True)
    
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    sns.histplot(data=data, x='distance', bins=20)
    plt.title('What is the distribution of flight distances?', wrap=True)
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    ax = sns.barplot(x='airline', y='cancellations', data=data)
    ax.set_title('What is the distribution of flight cancellations?')
    ax.set_xticklabels(ax.get_xticklabels(), rotation=45)
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        ax.xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    sns.boxplot(x='airline', y='flight_delay', data=data)
    plt.title('What is the distribution of flight delays by airline?', wrap=True)
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()
